title: LibGuides: COVID-19 Resources for Patients and Families: What to Expect After Being Vaccinated
author: Vesna Silobad
description: LibGuides: COVID-19 Resources for Patients and Families: What to Expect After Being Vaccinated
cleaned_text: Safety tips for people who are fully vaccinated. People are considered fully vaccinated two weeks after they get their second dose of an mRNA vaccine, such as Pfizer-BioNTech or Moderna, or two weeks after a single dose of the Janssen (Johnson & Johnson) vaccine. If you already got your COVID-19 vaccine, are you wondering when the immunity kicks in and how long it lasts? Can you still catch COVID-19 and can you infect others? How long do you need to take precautions after vaccination? A WHO's Doctor answers these questions.
